attributes.action: Stop one-man company Directors abusing the Tax system
attributes.additional_details:
There are many professionals (Accountants,  Lawyers, Engineers etc ) working in the UK through “one-man” limited company earning 1000's of pounds  but not paying their fair share of taxes (if they even pay any). Because these are small companies and are not subject to Audit, their employee/Director withdraws these monies as and when they want and choose to declare what they like by filing and declaring understated income and overstating expenses. They decide to close down these companies and open another without any challenges if they think they have overdone it.

What can government do?

Not to make "contracting" tax avoidance type of employment compared to PAYE.

1) Limited Company to be allowed where the company employs certain number of employees.
2) There should be withholding taxes on the payment to these professionals.
